# Define, structure, develop processes and tools, and show measurable results
* Marketing
# You will work on key projects in marketing, such as CRM, mobile, loyalty, and others to deliver high quality traffic, optimize conversion rates, and improve retention
# You will support implementing the international marketing strategy and its roadmap across markets
# You will keep a close eye on the market, competition and use your research to continuously improve marketing activities
* Sales
# You will identify and convert leads to active clients, including larger clients and strategic partnerships
# You will identify opportunities to further improve the sales processes, streamline operations and share best practices across markets
* Prep project for your new role
# In this module, you will identify and implement a complex project that prepares you for your new role

*What you'll bring to the team*
# Outstanding degree at a top university (likely: business administration, Wi-Ing or similar studies)
# Preferably gained professional experience in high-performance environments (strategy consulting, banking, start-up, small company or similar)
# Proven track record of professional achievements
# Project management: has planned, implemented and controlled major projects, in particular extensive analytical work
# Preferably: supported internationalization, set up new business verticals
# Google Suite or MS office, particularly strong in Spreadsheets and presentations
# Understanding of internet business models
# Extensive skills in project management
# Experience in business operations, background / experience in scaling internet companies

*What we offer you*
# Steep learning curve: Expect the steepest learning curve you have ever experienced - we are building a playground at passion.io to become the best version of ourselves. Meet and work with successful people worldwide to learn their success secrets.
# Value-based company: Be part of an open, honest, creative, and results-driven environment where your opinion is highly valued. We want to change the globe for the better by providing value to others.
# High-growth environment: You will be part of a strongly growing company with the opportunity to develop into a key contributor with incomparable responsibilities.
# Personal and professional development: You will tackle projects across departments and thereby gain a top-notch tool box to succeed in tackling bigger and bigger challenges.
# Autonomy / entrepreneurial work-style: You will only be measured by the results you produce and are in the driver’s seat, with full flexibility.
# Berlin: You will join our friendly and international team located in the heart of Berlin Mitte.

items.title: Junior Startup Sales Rep
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
Junior Startup Sales Rep
Ideally based in London

Our mission is to empower people and companies to use data to do transformative things. We provide technology and services that enables our users to collect the data that they want, use that data to understand each of one of their customer’s complete user journeys, and transform their business.

Snowplow has grown significantly over the last 12 months and we are now looking for our second Sales Development Representative to help us achieve even bigger things!

The Opportunity:
Our sales function is newly formed so, as the second Startup Sales Rep there is enormous scope for a talented individual to progress quickly and have real impact on how this team is formed over the next few years. Starting with qualifying inbound leads, the role will see someone go on to work closely with our marketing function to create innovative outbound sales material.

Within 3-9 months (depending on individual progression, there’s no pressure to be a sales expert within a few weeks), you’ll also learn how to carry out demos of our product and how to guide a customer through the entire sales journey, from initial call to customer.

The environment you’ll be working in:
Our culture is as unique as our customers. Over half of our employees work remotely from all over the world so we have fostered an environment based on trust, communication and transparency. You won’t find micro-management here and everyone takes ownership of their work. Collaboration is at the core of everything we do - we work together and learn from each other.
What you’ll be doing:
Managing inbound sales queries in Salesforce
Qualifying inbound leads and carrying out initial calls with potential customers to assess how/if our product could add real value to their business
Working closely with our marketing team to start producing some outbound lead generation
Gaining deep knowledge of our product offering with a view to being able to take over some demo calls
Achieving (and hopefully exceeding) monthly and quarterly sales targets
Effectively managing your workload & prioritising tasks

What you bring to the team:
Min 1 year experience in a sales role (preferably within a data analytics/SaaS environment)
A conscientious, caring & team-oriented attitude
Drive, enthusiasm and creativity
Passion for technology and adding value to businesses through data
Fantastic communication skills, both written and verbal
Confident, calm and collected nature
Self-motivated and always looking for opportunities to learn & improve

What you’ll get in return:
A competitive package based on experience, including share options
25 days of holiday a year (plus bank holidays)
Freedom to work wherever suits you best
Two fantastic company Away-Weeks in a different European city each year (next one is Milan in May 2018!)
Work alongside a supportive and talented team
Grow and develop in a fast-moving, collaborative organisation
Enjoy fun events in and around London organised by our Cultural Work Committee
Learn to code or improve your existing skills with our Software Development Guild
Convenient location in central London (Shoreditch)
Continuous supply of Pact coffee
Regular events with the team

items.title: Business Development Associate
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=8, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
DESCRIPTION
Hubble is on a mission to find the perfect home for every company. We’ve built an online marketplace to help businesses rent, manage and share office space in London. But this is just the beginning. The commercial property sector hasn’t kept up with the needs of new companies and still works like it did 20 years ago. Our vision is to completely transform the way commercial property is transacted, managed and financed.

As a Business Development Associate you will build partnerships with flexible office providers in London and beyond. You will also support clients in uploading and updating their listings. You will have direct contact with clients, interacting in-person and through email, live chat, and phone.

You should be willing to get stuck in, with a very ‘hands-on’ approach and work autonomously in a fast-paced, constantly changing environment. You’ll need to be able to communicate with cross functional teams from marketing to engineering.

You will operate at the heart of a fast growing startup and will therefore have plenty of opportunity to learn and contribute beyond your core role.

RESPONSIBILITIES
- Source and grow relationships with flexible office providers in London and beyond.
- Pitch potential clients on the benefits of working with Hubble, and support them through the onboarding process.
- Manage day to day relationships with Hubble’s existing office clients, making sure all their space is listed on Hubble, and keeping their availability up to date.
- Regularly review online and offline sources to identify and acquire office space not currently listed on Hubble.
- Work closely with new flexible office market entrants to help them advertise, sell and manage their space using Hubble.
- Source and advise companies looking to sublet space using Hubble.
- Work closely with the product team to build disruptive technologies for the flexible office sector.
- Work closely with the sales and support team and get stuck in where required.

REQUIREMENTS
- Energetic, passionate, and driven individual who can easily collaborate with others.
- Willing to get your hands dirty and work autonomously in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment.
- Sensitive to varied customer personalities and needs.
- At ease when communicating with others, whether that’s via email, phone or face to face.
- Technology savvy and willing to learn new tools.
- Conscientious, with excellent attention to detail.
- Strong work ethic and sense of ownership.
- Comfortable taking initiative, suggesting improvements and making decisions independent of others.

Big plus if you have;
- Experience of the flexible office sector.
- Experience working in startup environment.

BENEFITS
We make sure everyone in the team is comfortable and has the best environment for them. We offer flexible hours, remote working and have a relaxed attitude to taking holiday - focusing only on whether work gets done. Benefits can be tweaked on an individual basis depending on what makes you most productive. Here are some of the things we offer:

- Remuneration competitive with industry and level of experience.
-Equity options.
-Macbook, peripherals and standing desk.
- Expense budget & travel.
- Noise-cancelling headphones.
- Spotify Premium or Apple Music.
- Kindle Unlimited + free technical books.
- Health & Pension.
- Cycle to Work scheme.
- Additionally, being part of Entrepreneur First, 500 startups and Seedcamp gives us (and you) access to a vibrant startup community, office hours and talks with industry experts.

ABOUT HUBBLE

Hubble is backed by top venture capital firms Entrepreneur First, Seedcamp and 500 startups, and property tech specialists Spire Ventures (PiLabs). Hubble’s investors and advisors include founders & C-level including James Caan (Dragon’s Den and serial entrepreneur), Rohan Silva (Second Home, Former Policy Advisor to the Prime Minister), Jackson Hull (Student.com, Onefinestay), Brett Akker (Zipcar, Lovespace), Jonathan Galore (Wonga, Silverlake Partners) etc.

Hubble is an equal opportunities employer. We are a diverse bunch of people who are committed to maintaining a welcoming culture of inclusion and equality. We encourage applications from anyone that meets the requirements for the role.

items.title: Customer Account Manager
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
One in five households in the UK live in social housing, a sector with the right values at its core but that has historically struggled to deploy innovations in the home. Many residents still can’t afford to heat their homes and live in cold, mouldy properties they can’t be proud of. At Switchee, we believe that everyone deserves to live in a decent home and that the environments we inhabit have a massive influence on our ability to enjoy life and prosper.

We may be only three years old, but it’s already been quite a ride! Our first product, the internet connected Switchee thermostat is already in 35 of the biggest housing providers in the UK. We’re growing 100% year on year and are backed by some of the best-known investors in technology and social impact.

To strengthen our small team of 15 passionate and ambitious people we are looking for an outstanding individual to join us as

*Customer* *Account* *Manager*

We are driven by a collective desire to make a positive impact in the housing sector, both for residents and landlords, so your commitment to our values and mission are paramount.

*Your* *responsibilities*

As Customer Account Manager you will be responsible for all Switchee’s interactions with our most important Housing Association and Local Authority customers. You will co-ordinate the various touchpoints the Switchee team has with each customer, typically taking ownership from sales and working with our operations, development, marketing and leadership teams. Your ultimate responsibility will be the successful delivery of Switchee services to our large, complex landlord customers with the aim of building long-term (multi-year) commercial relationships based on trust. As we continue to develop our technology an important part of this role will be to develop a deep understanding of both our customers’ and end users needs so that you can input into Switchee product development.

Being more specific, you will:

* Be the main point of contact with up to 20 Switchee Customers
* Co-ordinate and oversee communication with each customer from various parts of the Switchee team; ensure that all deliverables are met on time
* Actively seek and grow relationships with all parts of each customer organization, focusing on relevant decision makers
* Pro-actively develop a deep understanding of customer and resident needs and how Switchee can either solve them today or develop solutions and/or commercial partnerships to solve them in the future
* Monitor and proactively grow the usage of Switchee data insights by all parts of a customer organisation
* Suggest and present new product features to our development team, demonstrating a clear understanding of customer value and the need for ROI
* Be constantly aware of the need to deliver customer and resident value and to measure and objectively report on this to a range of stakeholders
* Be aware that successful implementation of Switchee’s technology does not stop at the delivery of a dashboard, but will ultimately require changed customer behaviour (for example the switch from reactive to pro-active maintenance)
* Understand that blockers may be cultural/behavioural as well as technical and thrive in finding solutions to these
* Contribute to the growth of Switchee by building long-term commercial relationships with each customer


We are a company built on a strong technical foundation. You’ll need to grasp and communicate a technical solution with clients. We also expect you to work closely with Product Development to ensure our product evolves with the customer’s needs at the very centre.



*Your* *experience*

We firmly believe extraordinary people can come from a wide range of places – but we wouldn’t be surprised if the person who gets this role has:

* At least 3 years’ experience in management consultancy or a similar commercial field
* Bachelor’s degree from a top university
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
* Proven ability to develop and implement effective solutions to complex commercial problems
* Strong analytical & numeracy skills with complete command of Excel
* Fluency with large data sets and an ability to interrogate them for commercial insight
* Comfort talking in detail about the technology and processes required to manage large customer accounts
* B2B customer facing experience preferred
* Experience in a small & quickly expanding business
*Knowledge of the housing sector
* Experience working with Internet of Things devices


*You*

We are a diverse bunch of people at Switchee. That said, there are some characteristics we always look for:

* You deeply care about Switchee’s mission; you have a desire to build something revolutionary, that will disrupt an industry, and positively impact ordinary people’s lives.
* You care about the environment, are interested in energy efficiency and have thought about the challenges and opportunities posed by an evolving domestic energy market
* You like technology and neat solutions to complex problems
* You thrive on challenge and change; you naturally gravitate to the hardest questions first and love thinking differently to solve them.
* You are biased towards action and you’re happiest when you’re ‘getting stuff done’.
* You’re open, positive & straightforward. You’re not afraid to stand up for your convictions, even when it’s hard to do so.
* You delight in your colleagues’ successes and thrive on your failures; you grasp any opportunity for learning and constantly seek to improve.


*Our* *mission*

We believe that radical innovation in internet connected technology can ensure that every resident, every day, is living in a home that allows them to succeed. That’s why our products are built not just on great technology, but on an understanding of what people want from the space they live in.

This approach led us to reimagine the most mundane household object, a thermostat, into a product that automagically reduces energy bills, looks great and offers control to those who want it.

We are also revolutionising the way social landlords manage their housing stock with an obsessively tailored SAAS property dashboard and handy alerts on things like when the boiler is going to break.

Our next project is to build the ultimate connected hub for the social home. It’s going to revolutionise the way residents interact with their properties and landlords manage their homes.

*Life* *at* *Switchee*

We like to keep things simple and flexible at Switchee and consider you to be joining our family. We don’t currently track holidays so you’re free to take as much as you need. We occasionally work remotely but are sensitive to the needs of our colleagues.

We socialise together with regular outings in London and an annual “working remotely” trip where you have the option (but not obligation) to join us in working from a fun location.

If we end up working together, we can offer a competitive salary and a generous stake in the company.

If you believe in the same things, don’t hesitate any longer, apply now! Please be in touch soon as we’ll proceed once the right person is found. If you’d like to apply please submit a CV and cover letter on our Careers page.

items.title: Sales/Business Development
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
We are Resi. The straight-forward modern architect.


We believe in making world-class residential architecture accessible to all. Through our use of technology, we can offer a high quality and cost-effective service right across the UK.


Working here, you’ll discover that we do things a little differently to our competitors. We’re looking to shake up the architecture industry and so need an ambitious, no-holds-barred team to make this happen.


We have a fun, dynamic team, located in Bermondsey (though we’re moving to Elephant & Castle soon). Currently, we’re a small team of under 30, but we’re growing quickly and on the hunt for someone with a bit of hustle to join our business development team. Nope not cold calling. You help answer questions that homeowners might have before they commission us to undertake their project.


Most companies say they are an equal opportunities employer, but we really mean it. We are led by a female CEO and a female CTO. We actively encourage people who feel like they don’t fit the traditional stereotypes to apply. Your experience is all that matters.


Experience
• Likes helping people and talking
• Can hustle or put differently, can build rapport with people – we don’t like the hard sell
• 1-2 years sales experience (in any setting)
• Can write well
• Is diligent and hardworking
• Has a thirst for knowledge and picks things up quickly


Desirable but not essential:
• Has studied architecture (or even incomplete) or some form of construction experience
• Understands or has experience working on a building site, the lifecycle of a house extension (maybe you have done one) in an architecture firm or as a supplier (could be flooring / glazing / kitchens)


What we offer:
• A good London-based salary
• Commission
• The opportunity for rapid progress
• Ownership of your work & area
• On the job training
• 30 days holiday (inc Bank Holidays)
• The chance to help build a company from the ground up


All applications should include a CV and a cover letter/email as to why you think you would be a good fit for Resi

items.title: Social Media Manager
items.content:
Social Media Manager

Location: Remote Moscow
Role and job type: Marketing Full-time

Job Description

Akropolis is looking for a Social Media Manager to join our ambitious and highly motivated team. Brand Marketing will be transformational for the future of Akropolis and you will play a pivotal role in this. This position requires a high level of creativity, as well as the ability to use data-driven insights and other team member inputs to produce relevant material.

Akropolis has grown rapidly over the past few months and we are looking for someone who will be responsible for community building and growth across all social media channels. The ideal candidate should have a proven track record in managing Social Media in the crypto sphere.

Daily Operations:

  • Represent our brand on social media channels;
  • Deliver engaging and inspiring messages to our social audiences, with the goal of driving brand awareness and consideration;
  • Significantly grow our audience on social media;
  • Define and implement paid and organic growth strategies;
  • Turn our high level marketing strategy into a social media strategy and calendar;
  • Prioritize between channels, posts and messages;
  • Work together with influencers, internal, and external creative teams to build social content that engages and inspires large customer audiences;
  • Scale our social content across multiple markets and languages;
  • Drive engagement with our social community;
  • Ensure communication excellence and convert audience feedback into reputation/brand-building moments;
  • Drive and develop customer understanding through insightful analyses and actionable reporting;
  • Work closely together with the other channel managers to drive a consistent and differentiated brand message to a mix of countries and audiences.

Previous experience/skills:

  • Min 1-3 years experience managing large scale social media channels;
  • Working experience in a blockchain startup is a plus;
  • Strong understanding of the social media landscape and crypto trends;
  • Ability to define a strategy across multiple channels and to operate within them;
  • Operational mastery of owned Twitter, Facebook and Linkedin channels. Experience in other channels (Telegram, YouTube, Reddit) is a plus;
  • Ability to define and execute on audience growth strategies through paid and organic campaigns;
  • Good ideas on how to make our brand stand out in a competitive Fintech landscape.
  • Experience briefing and cooperating with creative teams in order to produce outstanding messaging;
  • You stay up-to-date on the latest trends in social media. You’re a first mover and identify the underlying trends before they grow;
  • You know the ins and outs of how to successfully collaborate with influencers;
  • Strong analytical and reporting skills; able to use the right data and metrics to optimize performance; strong Excel skills and familiarity with Ads tools;
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced cross-functional environment. Understand how to align and motivate a variety of stakeholders and influence their priorities;
  • Clear communicator with excellent command of written and spoken English.

What we offer:

  • Working with an international team of world-class professionals with experience in finance, pensions, blockchain and crypto industries;
  • A fulfilling, challenging and flexible work experience;
  • Competitive salary, performance-based bonuses;
  • Flexible working hours;
  • You can work remotely or from our office in Moscow;
  • Practically unlimited professional and career growth opportunities.

Salary range

Competitive

tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
*Role Summary*

We have an exciting opportunity for a sales professional to join our team as an Account Executive. Your role will be working as a valuable member of our sales team managing relationships with our amazing partner accounting firms.

We're growing at an incredible rate and generating huge growth in the accounting channel. This is a perfect time to join Chaser and make an instant impact and contribution to the company's success.

Chaser Account Executives are at the heart of our sales and customer service offering. Taking a consultative approach to form strong relationships with our accounting partners, assisting and guiding them with cloud strategy.

As cloud accounting adoption keeps increasing within accounting firms, you will have the unique position to help support and increase their client portfolio by adopting Chaser into their firms. You can truly help them become more efficient, add real value to their clients and help them become that go digital accounting firm they strive to become.

You'll be reporting directly to the Head of Partner Channel Sales. Our head office is located in Moorgate London; however, we do offer remote working for the right candidate.

*As a person you:*

* Have highly developed communication skills and a positive demeanour
* Are consultative, process driven and persistent, with excellent professional written and verbal communication skills
* Hard working but like to have fun and come to work with a smile on your face
* You will be extremely ambitious
* You will be someone who thrives in a high speed environment
* Digitally proficient, you will be excited to build an understanding of how best to use Chaser as a product. This will be essential for your success in the role

*What your role will consist of*

* Building a deep understanding of accounting and bookkeeping firms
* Acting as a trusted advisor to our accounting and bookkeeping partners and supporting change management in their firms
* Educating partners to help maximise growth
* Managing and respond to incoming partner enquiries
* Monitoring all existing and prospective partners progress through the sales funnel
* Maintaining and update the CRM system of all partners staff and contact details, alongside adding new partner enquiries
* Creating and running webinars
* Providing both online and onsite demos of Chaser

*Why you'll love Chaser*

At Chaser we value our people, we want them to enjoy the job they do and provide opportunities to love and grow their career. An exciting growing company we attract people who want to help us have a positive impact by helping our partner and their clients thrive and be successful. Our passionate, innovative Chaser team strive every day to make a meaningful impact. At Chaser, we truly value the input of every single member of the team. If successful, you'll be joining a sharp, welcoming group of people who will help you learn new skills and develop as an individual.

*Benefits*

* Competitive salary
* Share options
* Company pension scheme
* 25 days holiday
* Flexible working hours

If you're looking for a role that is exciting, challenging and diverse in which you can form lasting business and personal relationships, apply for the Chaser Account Executive position today.

*How to apply*

In applying, please answer the following questions:

# Why have you applied for this role?
# What is your proudest professional or academic achievement and why? - ( Max 200 words)
# Are you eligible to work in the UK?

items.title: Student or Graduate Sales Exec position
items.content:
Driven Media is a Truck and HGV advertising specialists. We utilise the valuable but often unused space on the side of trucks, and rent it to run campaigns for our clients and advertisers.

Following our appearance on Dragons Den, and successful investment at the start of this year, we are now looking to expand our remote sales team and take on 2 or 3 current students or recent graduates who want to make a name for themselves.

The role involves marketing your respective geographical areas, and utilising the contacts and companies at your disposal in order to get our brand name out into the market place. You will be tasked with landing 3/6/ 12 month campaigns and will receive a healthy commission percentage in return. We are also offering initial and ongoing training, a Sales Buddy to guide and support you with your clients, and will support you with generating inbound leads, marketing and how get the best form your sales efforts.

In addition to a healthy 10% commission per campaign (average client campaign being worth £8,000), you can also benefit from a lucrative 'fast start' bonus, which rewards those team members who hit the ground running, and have the passion and stamina to succeed in the highly competitive market that is advertising space. This bonus scheme could be with up to £3,200 extra within your first 6 months!

So if you are a fast self-starter, wanting to make a name for yourself in sales and marketing, love negotiation and closing deals, and want to earn uncapped commission to subsidise your studies, please apply below and lets start a conversation.

Every relationship has to start somewhere, and this could be your next big opportunity.

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Rockstar Graduate Sales Honchos

We’re scouring London for Rockstar Sales Honchos who are talented, inspired and have a tenacious get-up-and-go attitude. Join our fun, fast-growing, early stage prop-tech start-up as a graduate Sales Honcho.

Your role

You’ll be boomeranging around London’s estate agencies, selling in-person, our cutting-edge technology software. The product is the industry-disrupting ‘Agency in a Box’ – which provides agencies with everything and anything they need to manage and grow their businesses. This includes 360° virtual property viewings, mobile apps, websites and entire back office software. All of this can be accessed remotely, anywhere in the world. We are constantly innovating; we are soon to roll out our virtual reality goggles and aerial drones.

We are facing unprecedented demand for our tech, and now is a perfect time to join an early-stage core team. £23k basic, plus uncapped commission which you earn with every sale.

You

• Get up and go attitude
• Enthusiasm
• Work-ethic
• A hunger to learn, improve and succeed
• Proactive
• Confident and fun
• Emotionally intelligent

We will support you to learn, develop and grow throughout this role – providing you with the foundations of a successful career in sales. No experience is necessary – we prioritise tenacity and diligence over everything else.

Show us what you’ve got in your two-month probation period and we’ll completely invest in you. You’ll be the head of a two/three-person appointment booking team that work for you to secure your appointments. You’ll then spend your days smashing them.

Our mission

The GNB was created in 2010 as a charity – set up to end homelessness through a global humanitarian platform. We wanted to fund this ourselves rather than rely on governments and donations… so we started our prop-tech start-up, GNB Properties, in 2016. Our mission is not profit motivated – it is exclusively social. We only exist to serve our mission.

Send us your CV and a short covering letter persuading us why you want to be a Sales Honcho. Our phone number is also below.

www.gnbproperty.com
02037 892 892

Curious to know more? Watch our 1-minute video!
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5m3K8MvJTmQ

items.title: Client Services Account Manager
items.content:
Client Services Account Manager

Our unique London-based B2B prospecting service is looking to recruit an outgoing Client Services Account Manager. You’ll be responsible for taking the lead on the day to day client management, building rapport with both new and existing clients and working closely with the internal teams to deliver campaigns. You’ll hit the ground running digesting briefs, managing the copywriting and client onboarding processes. No 2 days will be the same so it’s important that you thrive in a fast-paced environment and have the ability to manage workload efficiently.

Founded in 2017, we are on a mission to provide best-in-class, white labelled, business
development services which translate into new sales opportunities for our clients.

To be considered, you must possess the following experience/skills.

-An expert listener - empathetic to the needs of our clients.
-Ideally, you’ll come with a few years’ experience working in a client facing role, ideally within sales and marketing.
-You’ll be highly organised with the ability to manage clients from a diverse workload.
-Commercial awareness, with the ability to manage and grow your accounts.
-You’ll have the ability to build relationships with ease and you’ll keep a cool head under pressure.
-A team player attitude, ready to roll up your sleeves and get stuck in.
-Able to build and develop long-term client relationships.
-A background in Business Development is desirable.
-A background in working for Start-ups.
-Comfortable working remotely.
-Proficient in Excel, Powerpoint, Word and the suite of Google cloud-based products.
- Familiar with using all Social Networking platforms - specifically LinkedIn
- A natural flair for marketing would be an advantage.
-Comfortable learning and working with online software packages.

This full-time position offers flexible and remote working conditions, however, you will be expected to travel to London on occasion for training and meetings.

Shrinking violets need not apply - we need a confident, self-motivated, proactive individual. We are a fast-paced, ever-changing start-up, and we need someone who comes up with ideas and isn’t afraid to share them! For the right person, we offer the opportunity to work for a modern, progressive company. You will have the ability to join us at a very exciting time of growth. Joining us from this early stage will allow you real scope for career progression, and you will be key to driving our continued success. We are looking for people that can inject new ideas and initiatives to support the ongoing growth and expansion of the business. Alongside a competitive salary, fun social events, employee discounts, and company pension scheme you’ll be joining a team of world-class experts in a Sales agency that offers outstanding training and progression.

As part of the interview process, you will be expected to clearly demonstrate how you managed the expectations of clients and resolved difficult challenges. You will also demonstrate how you went beyond the call of duty to support a client's need.

items.content:
We are looking for an BUSINESS STRATEGIST INTERN for a new coworking network in London. The right candidate must be able to manage the platform’s online marketing activities, such as monitoring the traffic on the website, creating search-engine friendly content, and create and manage digital marketing campaigns.

The right candidate:

The right candidate feels comfortable to work independently and have an entrepreneurial mindset. In addition, the applicant has a strong understanding of digital marketing.

Responsibilities:

- Producing and updating inspirational and high quality, search engine-friendly text content
- Search engine optimisation (SEO)
- Setting up and monitoring conversion tunnels and goals
- UX updates and split testing on site
- Monitoring online marketing activities and analysis of web traffic in Google Analytics
- Setting up and optimising Google AdWords campaigns
- Assisting with newsletters and social media related tasks
- Assisting with writing blog articles

About you:

- Have a genuine and passionate interest in
- A minimum of two up to five years of experience in online marketing or business analysis
- Extensive experience and knowledge of Google AdWords, Google Analytics, Facebook Ads, etc.
- Is an excellent writer and is able to communicate clearly and constructively
- Is self-driven, able to keep motivation high and get the job done on time, properly and consistently
- Able to work independently and remotely
- Creative and full of brilliant ideas
- Have an international marketing perspective
- Is IT-savvy and comfortable with various systems as your daily tools
- Has the ability to develop exciting and relevant content to engage the relevant target group
- Excellent English communication skills, both written and oral


If you wish to apply for this Online Marketing Specialist position, please send your CV, cover letter and some examples of what you have done in the past.
